findings.title: Denial of Services in Balance Checking
findings.description: The platform admin won't be able to execute the core functions of the contract, causing disruption of service and loss of reputation to the platform.

findings.title: Arbitrary Price Setting
findings.description: The price of assets can be manipulated by the owner to gain a profit when burning the $BRI to transfer the base token back.

findings.title: Use of Upgradable Contract Design
findings.description: The logic of the affected contract can be arbitrarily changed, allowing the proxy owner to perform malicious actions, e.g., stealing user funds anytime they want.
findings.contract: BrightRiskToken PriceFeed AbstractController InsuracePositionController NexusPositionController BridgeLeveragedPositionController

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: Critical state variables can be updated at any time by the controlling authorities without notifying users.
findings.function: addController(), removeController(), setMinimumDeposit(), setDepositFee(), adjustStreamingFee(), setSwapViaAt(), setSwapRewardsViaAt(), setPriceFeed(), addChainlinkAggregator(), setInternalPrice()

findings.title: Smart Contract with Unpublished Source Code
findings.description: The smart contract source code is not publicly published, which may cause users to misunderstand the functionalities and logic of the smart contract, leading to undesired actions.
findings.contract: BrightRiskToken PriceFeed AbstractController InsuracePositionController NexusPositionController BridgeLeveragedPositionController

findings.title: Insufficient Logging for Privileged Functions
findings.description: Privileged functions that are executable by the controlling parties are not logged properly by emitting events.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: Functions with improper visibility can lead to unintended access and potential security risks.

findings.title: Inexplicit Solidity Compiler Version
findings.description: The Solidity compiler versions declared in the smart contracts were not explicit, which may potentially result in compatibility issues.
